I am a research assistant at the Bank of Canada in the Monetary Policy and Financial Studies Division. I'm currently applying to PhD programs in economics and finance. 

I'm interested in macroeconomics, international economics and finance with a view to understanding international differences in productivity. Currently, I am using supply and use tables to compare sectoral fixed capital investment allocations between countries and examining the relationship between these investment allocations and the transmission of productivity shocks.

Aside from economics, I like solving crosswords with my wife, playing guitar and watching good movies.
